# Q10
<br>
A random experiment is a procedure (real or imagined) which:<br>
1. Has a well-defined set of possible outcomes.<br>
2. Could (at least in principle) be repeated arbitrarily many times.<br>

<br>
An event is a set (i.e., a collection) of possible outcomes of a given random experiment.
<br><br>
A sample space is the set of all possible outcomes of interest for a random experiment.
